vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Admin Credentials
vulnerabilities.description: Admin login uses hardcoded credentials (admin@onekeel.com / password123)
vulnerabilities.impact: Complete system compromise possible with known credentials
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Remove hardcoded credentials, implement database authentication with bcrypt

vulnerabilities.title: Authentication Bypass Flag
vulnerabilities.description: SKIP_AUTH environment variable completely bypasses all authentication
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Remove SKIP_AUTH mechanism completely from production code

vulnerabilities.title: Weak Default JWT Secret
vulnerabilities.description: Default JWT secret is weak and publicly visible
vulnerabilities.impact: JWT tokens can be forged if default secret is used
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Generate strong, unique JWT secret and store securely

vulnerabilities.title: No Database Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: Authentication system does not validate against database users
vulnerabilities.impact: Cannot manage real users, relies on hardcoded data

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Session Management
vulnerabilities.description: JWT tokens are not tracked in database sessions
vulnerabilities.impact: Cannot revoke tokens, no session tracking
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement session storage and token blacklisting

vulnerabilities.title: No Rate Limiting
vulnerabilities.description: No rate limiting on authentication endpoints
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement rate limiting on login attempts

vulnerabilities.title: Plain Text Password Comparison
vulnerabilities.description: Passwords compared in plain text without hashing
